name: Mohamad Gharib
content: Mohamad Gharib About Me I am an Associate Professor in Information Systems at the Institute of Computer Science, University of Tartu. I am conducting research in the broad area of Socio-Technical Systems (STS) Design. I was a Lecturer of Software Engineering at the same Institute. Before that, I was a postdoctoral researcher  at the Resilient Computing Lab (RCL)  research group of the University of Florence, and I was a postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Information Engineering and Computer Science, University of Trento, Italy, where I have obtained my Ph.D. degree in April 2015. Research Interest I am conducting research in the board area of design science with special emphasis on Socio-Technical Systems (STS) design as well as Cyber-Physical System-of-Systems (CPSoS) design. Award & Achievements September 2020 Distinguished Paper Award: COPri - a Core Ontology for Privacy Requirements Engineering. Presented at the International Conference on Research Challenges in Information Science (RCIS’20) by Mohamad Gharib, John Mylopoulos and Paolo Giorgini. Teaching - latest courses Enterprise System Integration - MTAT.03.229 - Spring Semester - 2021/22 - Now, Masters degree - Institute of Computer Science, University of Tartu, Estonia. Objectives: The objective of this course is to introduce principles and methods for designing, developing, and integrating enterprise information systems. The course introduces modern approaches to enterprise system integration, including resource-oriented architectures and their associated technologies, as well as patterns of API design and enterprise integration. Web application development - LTAT.05.004 - Fall Semester - 2021/22 - Now, Bachelor degree - Institute of Computer Science, University of Tartu, Estonia. Objectives: This course introduces key concepts for developing modern web applications, and covers numerous Web languages (e.g., HTML, CSS, Javascript), front-end (e.g., Vue.js) and back-end development frameworks (e.g., Node.js). Distributed Real time Cyber Physical Systems - B027549 (B059) - Fall Semester - 2018-2021, Masters degree, University of Florence, Italy. Objectives: This course aims at providing solid knowledge and competences to conceive, define and design complex cyber physical systems which are at the basis of emerging fields as Internet of Things (IoT), Smart Factories and Critical Infrastructures. In particular focus is put on the distribution and coordination aspects of the constituent systems of an SoS and on time management issues.
